Kim Jong Il mourns death of famous artist
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il mourns death of famous artist
   Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Friday sent a wreath to the bier of Jong Yong Man, chairman of the c.c., the Korean Artists Union and vice-director general of the Mansudae Art Studio, expressing deep condolences over his death.   The late Jong was a "Kim Il Sung Prize" winner, a twice Labour Hero and a People's Artist.   He produced a number of famous fine art works including Korean painting "the Evening Glow Over Kangson" and "the Red Glow Over Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu" and thus greatly contributed to breaking new ground in Korean painting and further developing the Juche-oriented fine art.   He died of a fatal disease at the age of 61 on Thursday.

articles.title: Greetings to Seychellois President
articles.content:
Greetings to Seychellois President
   Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to president France Albert Rene on June 14 on the occasion of the National Day of Seychelles.   In the message Kim expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further strengthen and develop.    He also wished the President and people of Seychelles greater success in their work for building a prosperous, new society.

Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouse built in Sariwon
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouse built in Sariwon
   Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- The Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia greenhouse has been built in Sariwon, a gateway to Pyongyang.   Covering more than 10,000 square metres, all its sides and roof are covered with glass.    The greenhouse is capable of cultivating more than 10,000 Kimilsungia and Kimjongilias a year. It has  an exhibition hall, a tissue culture room which is capable of cultivating and propagating flowers on a scientific basis, a room for technical preparation, a dormant room, an air cooler room and other facilities.   
   An opening ceremony of the greenhouse took place on June 18.
   Present there were Kim Ki nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea, officials concerned, working people, youth and students in the city.   At the end of the ceremony the participants went round with keen interest Kimilsungia and Kimjongilias in full bloom in the greenhouse.

articles.title: Inter-governmental cooperation between DPRK and Bulgaria
articles.content:
Inter-governmental cooperation between DPRK and Bulgaria
    Pyongyang, June 19 (KCNA) -- A protocol and agreements between the DPRK and Bulgarian governments were signed in Sofia on June 16.   A protocol of the 21st meeting of the Inter-Governmental Economic, Scientific and Technical Consultative Committee between the  DPRK and Bulgaria was signed by DPRK vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Kim Pong Ik and  vice-Minister of Foreign Trade and Tourism of Bulgaria, Mariana Asenova while an agreement on  the promotion and protection of investment was signed by vice-Minister Kim Pong Ik and Minister of Foreign Trade and Tourism of Bulgaria Velentin Vessilev.  An agreement on the prevention of double taxation of income and property was signed by DPRK ambassador to Bulgaria Kim Man Ik and Bulgarian Finance Minister Muravei Radev.
